verses.verse: "Do not judge so that you will not be judged.
You see, with the judgment that you judge, you will be judged, and with the measurement that you measure out, it will be measured back to you.
Why do you see the wood chip, the one in the eye of your brother, but the log in your eye you do not take a closer look at?
Or how will you state to your brother, 'Leave it. I will take the wood chip out from your eye' and, look, the log is in your eye?
Faker, first take the log out of your eye, and then you will see clearly to take the wood chip out of the eye of your brother.
You should not give what is sacred to the dogs. Neither should you throw your pearls in front of the hogs so that they might not traipse on them with their feet and, after turning around, rip you.
Ask and it will be given to you. Look and you will find. Knock and it will be opened to you.
You see, everyone who asks receives, the person who looks finds, and to the person who knocks, it will be opened.
Or what person is from among you, whom if his son asks for bread — he will not give a stone over to him, will he?
And if he asks for a fish — he will not give a snake over to him, will he?
So if you, who are evil, know to be giving good presents to your children, how much more will your Father, the One in the heavens, give good things to the people who ask Him?
So everything, however many things that you may want that the people do to you, this is what you also must be doing to them. You see, this is the Law and the Preachers.
Go in through the narrow gate because the wide gate and its spacious road is the gate leading off into the ruin, and the people going in through it are many
because the gate and the road that has gone through hard times is narrow (the one leading off into the life), and the people finding it are few.
Be cautious of the fraudulent preachers, some who come to you in sheep costumes, but on the inside they are vicious wolves.
From their fruits, you will correctly understand them. They do not gather up grape clusters from thorns, or figs from thistles, do they?
In this way, every good tree produces nice fruits, but the defective tree produces evil fruits.
A good tree is not able to be producing evil fruits. Neither is a defective tree able to be producing nice fruits.
Every tree that does not produce nice fruit is chopped out and thrown into a fire.
Clearly, from their fruits you will definitely correctly understand them.
Not everyone saying to Me, 'Master, Master,' will go into the empire of the heavens, only the person doing what My Father (the One in the heavens) wants.
Many will state to Me in that day, 'Master, Master, didn't we preach with Your name, with Your name throw demons out, and with Your name show many abilities?'
And at that time, I will acknowledge to them, 'I never ever knew you. Distance yourself away from me, you, the people who work for the crime.'
So everyone, any who listen to these My messages and do them I will liken him to a focused man, someone who built his house on the rock.
And the rain tumbled down, the rivers came, the winds blew, they fell toward that house, and it did not fall. You see, the foundation had been laid on the rock.
And everyone who listens to these My messages and does not do them, he will be like a foolish man, someone who built his house on the sand.
And the rain tumbled down, the rivers came, the winds blew, they beat against that house, and it fell. And its fall was huge."
And it happened when Jesus totally finished these messages; the crowds were being impressed based on His teaching.
You see, He was teaching them as a person having authority and not as the Old Testament transcribers.
